page.title: 01NEWBOROUGH in rural Staffs.
page.content: { NEWBOROUGH}village lies in a river valley (the Swarbourne){107m.}above sea level. It has a population of{321 (many widows, many over 40). It is surrounded by gentle hills, remnants of{Needwood Forest}and agricultural land (under varying use) some of which is owned by the{Duchy of Lancaster.} It is a crossroads settlement with a village square 6m.from{Uttoxeter}and 8m.from{Burton-on-Trent}both reachable by 'bus from the village. There is a mixture of old & new houses, mostly brick-built with Staffordshire tiled roofs & one thatched cottage. It has a Church, Junior School, Youth & Community Centre, Shop/Post Office, 2 Public Houses + B&B accomodation, children's playing field and cricket field. There is no mains gas nor sewerage in the area though the latter is planned for the near future (1986).
